intro: Sersalisia afzelii, commonly known as the African sarsaparilla, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to tropical Africa. It is a shrub characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy on the underside. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by small, three-lobed berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The plant has been used traditionally for its medicinal properties, though its botanical study remains limited.
